item.title: The Fed is unlikely to cut rates, but this week's meeting is packed with intrigue
item.description: Considering nothing is likely to happen when it comes to major policy decisions, the meeting promises several fascinating subplots.

item.title: The EU-U.S. trade deal could have one unexpected winner: The UK
item.description: The EU-U.S. trade agreement has been met with scepticism as concerns over what it means for the bloc have emerged.

item.title: Even with high tariffs, Trump's trade war suddenly is starting to look not so scary on Wall Street
item.description: Economists cite several factors as reasons for why the landscape looks less dire.

item.title: Trump says he believes Powell is ready to start lowering rates
item.description: Trump on Friday expressed confidence the Fed will start cutting, a day after he met with central bank Chair Jerome Powell.

item.title: Textiles to whisky: U.K.â€“India 'historic' deal is set to boost bilateral trade by over $34 billion a year
item.description: The deal was signed in the presence of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his UK counterpart, Keir Starmer.
